website_summaries.verdict: While it doesn't sound quite as good as the larger Play:5, the Sonos Play:3 delivers a superior streaming-audio experience that you can control from any iOS device or Android smartphone.
pros: You can control the Sonos Play:3 single-speaker streaming-audio system from any iPhone, iPod Touch, iPad, or Android smartphone using a free app

It offers good sound, its compact, elegant design cuts down on cord clutter, and it can stream Internet-based radio and audio services, plus your own digital music collection, from any Mac, PC, or NAS drive
Also, it's simple to set up, particularly if you already own a Sonos system, and linked Sonos players (purchased separately) can cover up to 31 additional rooms
cons: The Play:3 has almost no stereo separation and doesn't offer the detail and clarity of the step-up Play:5
Also, while it can wirelessly interact with other Sonos products, you'll need a hard-wired connection or the $49 wireless Sonos Bridge accessory if it's your only Sonos component

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. THEY'RE ENDING SOFTWARE UPDATES & RENDERING THEIR HARDWARE OBSOLETE.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. THEY'RE ENDING SOFTWARE UPDATES & RENDERING THEIR HARDWARE OBSOLETE. i was a big fan of sonos when they first came out and have since purchased tens of thousands of dollars of their audio equipment for my restaurants. now they're telling me that they're ending software updates and forcing me to buy new equipment. they're clearly not doing well as a company and are forcing obsolescence on their customers to increase sales.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Mcnulty

customer_reviews.title: Sonos End of Life for 2 yr old product - SHAME!
customer_reviews.text: Sonos is ending support for its older products, but hey its ok as they are offering a generous (NOT) 30% discount on a trade in for a new product. Can't believe I recommended this company and their products to my friends, and will have to find a new solution rather than trade-in as I can never trust this company again. Lame excuses about processing power is nothing more than a naked grab for cash making everyone buy new, overpriced equpiment that will probably be obselete in a few years again.
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent as a stereo pair
customer_reviews.text: sounds fantastic as a stereo pair or as surround for a playbar - can't really justify the price for playbar surrounds so I have them as a stereo pair in another room. A good step up from the play 1s with more bass and deeper sound profile - certainly the play 5s would expand on this further but I can get play 3s in a stereo pair for the price of one play 5 and the stereo pair sounds fantastic! Make sure you do the trueplay tuning - makes a big difference in sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: my2cents

customer_reviews.title: Just ehhh.....
customer_reviews.text: I wound up returning this and ordering a Play 5 which I am very happy with. There's a world of difference between the 3 and the 5 in my opinion. I realize the 3 is half the cost, but even at that, I'd say just get a pair of 1's before i'd get a 3. It has kind of a "tin like" boombox type sound in my opinion. At louder volumes the bass does kick in and overtake the mids to which it sounds a little better, but still nothing like the 5. I also have the play ones with a sound bar and sub that I enjoy for what it's worth. Good luck :-)
customer_reviews.author: batman

customer_reviews.title: sounds great but not Alexa friendly really
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these for the kitchen living room area of house. Sounds great and lets you use Alexa to stream music, but not very well. Normally with Alexa speakers you can place them in groups so you can play music in different areas at once. NOT SONOS. !!!! you can either play music on it alone or other Alexa speakers. In other words just a glorified bluetube speaker. If I had know this would not have paid the price they wanted. So yes it works with Alexa but not how normal people want. Was going to buy others, but no thanks not worth the money for dumb speakers. yes it says that it will someday but no updates
customer_reviews.author: Jorge L. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and so easy to use that your 5 year old and your grandmother can operate it!
customer_reviews.text: SONOS equipment is THE superior wireless brand. Everything they make has been flawless. I am an A/V and IT installer and we have put hundreds of these in multi million dollar homes in the resort town of Jackson Hole and I honestly do not recall having to repair or replace a singe unit.......The Play 3 is VERY GOOD.........the Play 5 will BLOW YOU AWAY!
customer_reviews.author: andrea burchard

customer_reviews.title: Connected system with existing wired speakers. Would work for ...
customer_reviews.text: Connected system with existing wired speakers. Would work for a few songs, then the system would automatically lower the volume of the wired speakers so effectively, they were off . Do not buy if you plan to integrate this with wired speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Smith

customer_reviews.title: LOVE...LOVE...LOVE MY SONOS
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd speaker with Sonos and I obviously love it! I have the sound bar and the bass and 2 speakers. At our beach house I bought the sound bar and just one speaker to place outside when we are relaxing. The great thing is that I am not very technical and even I can hook it up and it sound!!! This is quite a feat in my eyes. I love the fact that I have an app that controls the Sonos and completely rely on Pandora for my music these days. I would not hesitate to buy this speaker.
customer_reviews.author: shopinful

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good, connectivity is rubbish if you use Spotify
customer_reviews.text: Every. Single. Other. Device I have, Echo's, Playstation, Xbox, Onkyo receiver, etc all work flawlessly with Spotify Connect. The Sonos is incapable of functioning with Spotify connect...almost at all. It will stop playing, skip tracks, decide it's just not going to work at all some days, etc. The two stars it earned are for the two things that work: - Sound quality is good - Integrating Soundcloud and other music platforms through the app is pretty decent Beyond that, trying to use it as an office speaker has been so frustrating that if I hadn't thrown the box away immediately after opening it I would have sent it back ages ago.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Scam
customer_reviews.text: Rendered useless after 3 years. Stuck in their proprietary network to begin with, after an update it wouldn't connect and I was told I need to upgrade. You can't play your own music to begin with, only the services SONOS has a relationship with. Seriously. Have contacted several large litigation firms specializing in class action suits.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Casteel

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy to set up and sounds great
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to set up and sounds great! I'm truly more satisfied then I thought I would be with the sound quality. One thing I wasn't expecting was that all music is streamed through the actual Sonos app, I had originally thought that streaming would work similar to how Chromecast works. This however ends up being a great way to connect multiple music services and queue music through them all but play the songs as if they were all through one single service.
customer_reviews.author: Tory B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to an Existing System
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time in impeccable condition. Intended to install it the next day but Jane grabbed it and installed it herself. Instructions and packaging were easily followed and she had it working on our previously installed Sonos network in less than an hour. The ability to use two PLAY:3's and a Play:5 separately makes differing musical tastes manageable. The Sonos system continues to deliver better sounding music with each software upgrade. Great system!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff O'Byrne

customer_reviews.title: When it works, they are fine.  But they RARELY work and customer support sucks
customer_reviews.text: I have three Sonos 3 speakers. They worked lk for a while but the company updates it software so often, you have to reset your connections, which is a pain. The updates are now so complicated I can't even get my system to connect. Unless you are a hard-core techie and willing to update software settings constantly, avoid this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Paul White

customer_reviews.title: rocks
customer_reviews.text: The sound is amazing. I have been using a Bose dock and it is similar, but am just using the dock for iPod now and Sonos for music from my phone via Spotify. Super easy. I think you definitely need the 3 for a living area, mine is not very big and I think the 1 would not be enough...glad I got the 3. Will definitely add the 1 for my bedroom/bath area. I can't review setup because my kids did it for me, but they said it was easy and took minutes to do. Everyone needs this Sonos.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth H Swain

customer_reviews.title: Size matters!
customer_reviews.text: We bought the PLAY:3 for our great room but it proved to be too small for that large space. The sound was tinny and flat, even trying different room locations and speaker orientations. We moved it to our master bedroom and now we have perfect sound from the PLAY:3! So bottom line, the dimensions of the room really make a difference on the sound of this unit. For the great room I bought a PLAY:5 and it is the perfect speaker for that space. I now have Sonos in every room of my house!
customer_reviews.author: AzGal

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the size
customer_reviews.text: We have several of these speakers spread throughout our house, and I'd say for most of the rooms they are able to fill it with sound quite nice. For larger rooms the PLAY:5 may have been better, but I didn't want to spend quite that much on speakers. I think these were a good compromise between size and price. We have since bought more of this size to fill other areas of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these along with a Play 5. Now my kitchen has tunes. The play 3's really expand the sound of the Play 5. Not quite as effective in the low end, but close. Now no lower volume dead spots and totally immersive sound. This combo totally fills a 20 x 30 ft kitchen/ dining area with good sounding music. Working in the kitchen or cleaning is most enjoyable now. App and setup could be done by a chimp.
customer_reviews.author: Everett Winslow Throckmorton III

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous sound throughout your house
customer_reviews.text: I bought one Sonos PLAY:3 in 2016 and was amazed at the sound quality - which is better than my compact Bose speakers! We usually stream Google Play on it so we can call up any song or artist we like on demand. But we also play TuneIn channels like Radio Paradise or our favorite SiriusXM stations. After a year, I finally bought a second PLAY:3 for the 2nd floor of our home and it's great to roam around the house listening to your favorite music uninterrupted. My wife and I both realky love this little speaker. I can't recommend it highly enough. I wish I'd bought these earlier...
customer_reviews.author: Tirebiter 88011

customer_reviews.title: Love the Sonos system
customer_reviews.text: Love the Sonos system. Was finally able to buy another as they are not cheap. But they are worth it. The system is very flexible. If you have multiple speakers you can set two up for stereo, or play different play lists in each room or the same on all. When you want to add a song to the play list you can make it stop the current song and play the new one. Play the new song after the current song ends or put the new song at the end of hte play list. And the sound quality is GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, but doesn't knock your socks off.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good, looks good. I have had a few issues with wireless interference that Sonos has helped to correct. All in all, a good and well built product, but it didn't pack the bass that I expected as compared to my Play 1s. Would be best suited for a small space (study, larger bath, or small bedroom). Like I said good product if you're like me and have too much invested in SONOS already, but if you're looking for bass and haven' already boxed yourself into SONOS, I'd check out other items before I buy.
customer_reviews.author: JJ-Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Won't connect to Spotify
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good when it decides to connect to Spotify. Otherwise, it's just a very expensive grey box that sits on the counter. Sonos support was a waste of time. DNS and wifi strength were there only suggestions I check/fix, but I'm able to stream Spotify from the same spot on the house as the speaker, that's clearly not the problem. Now I have an expensive grey plastic box.
customer_reviews.author: ShaneRayBlazer

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Sound and Excellent Control
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of each of the Sonos Play speakers 1, 3, and 5), and, as expected, the Player 5 has the best sound, but each speaker has very good sound for its size. The real attraction for my family, however, is the ability to control the output of each speaker with a smart phone, tablet, or desktop computer. The speakers can be linked together or something different can be played on each speaker at the same time. I’m also impressed by the wide variety media that can be played through these speakers. I listen to music stored on my computer, music stored in the clouds, music services, and music/talk steamed from radio stations.
customer_reviews.author: j2ink

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best!
customer_reviews.text: SONOS is the best speaker system out there in the wireless industry. The app is easy to use and intuitive. The selection of streaming music that works with SONOS is huge and it lets you play your Apple music on your devices very easily. We own a soundbar, sub-woofer, 2 Play 3's for our surround sound system and just added a new zone by purchasing this Play 3 for our patio.
customer_reviews.author: S. Dinkin

customer_reviews.title: Bigger sound than the play:1
customer_reviews.text: We have two play:1s and got this play:3 for our two story living room. The 1 was great but this one sounds even better (as it should). The Sonos ecosystem is great and we like the fact that we can group all the speakers together for those rare times when my wife and I want to listen to the same music in different parts of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Kapil Chandra

customer_reviews.title: Without account useless
customer_reviews.text: Purchased years ago ALL products from Sonos. Good sound quality but during the time the Sonos app wanted more and more data. End of 2018: Sonos app is useless without Sonos account. I switched ALL devices to Kodi's on Raspberry Pi's. Greetings from George Orwell, Sonos.
customer_reviews.author: Ingo 11

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound. But I expected it to have the ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound. But I expected it to have the capability to go much louder. That's disappointing In an otherwise excellent sounding speaker.
customer_reviews.author: sadiayah

customer_reviews.title: ... about a month now and so far I am pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Play 3 for about a month now and so far I am pleased with it. The size of it is a little bit larger than I expected, but over all its great! I looks and sounds nice and fits in with the rest of my home design. Although this a matter of opinion, the only con that I have is the lack of bass. It sounds great but lacks the umph of the low end.
customer_reviews.author: Num1Vet

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy to play stored music from your phone!
customer_reviews.text: Sonos has decided to stop supporting playing stored music from your phone. This means these speakers can only be used if you subscribe to a paid streaming service. You can also make lay from a laptop which is quite limiting for home entertainment use, and who knows how long they’ll support that? These are not cheap speakers and the sudden decrease in usability tells me that you can’t rely on them.
customer_reviews.author: AJJ23

customer_reviews.title: This is just awesome. I have it in my kitchen and use ...
customer_reviews.text: This is just awesome. I have it in my kitchen and use the phone app to skip songs. The sound is great and it's easy to set up. I want these for every room in my house! I mainly use it for music but I want to get the set up for TV as well.
customer_reviews.author: Chantrelle B

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING sound!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality and sound. I have the 5.1 system set up (Soundbar, Amp, and two PLAY:3 as my rear-speakers. I can't say enough about this product and ease of use! I do wish there was a way to mount them on my wall and hide the power cord. I love listening to music and the quality on them for music is amazing. I don't have one as a single, so I can't comment on that, but as a 5.1 sound system, very, very good!
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: Sonos makes the best small speakers
customer_reviews.text: Sonos makes the best small speakers... from sound to construction. I use this one in a spare room and the sound is great. Well built and solid unit. The bass is terrific for such a small item. I only needed one speaker in the room so I went with this one and am very pleased. A+++ product.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Terrible app
customer_reviews.text: We've had nothing but problems with the Sonos app which is the only way to play music with this speaker. 6 months after buying this speaker Sonos ditched the app and new models are compatible with Apple Airplay 2, but not the Sonos 3 speaker. Now we have a 9 month old speaker and stuck with the Sonos app which they are obviously not putting resources to improving. Drops songs all the time. Can't access all of your music. Cumbersome interface.
customer_reviews.author: C. Samuelson

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers, easy to set up and now I have full music access!
customer_reviews.text: Just got them, within 10 minutes, they were playing music. Sonos definitely put the work into their software as I have always wanted to access all the music on my laptop hard drive, even if it's in standby mode. We had to change a few settings on the MacBook, but now it works like a dream. Sounds is good, hard to tell the actual quality of the speakers as I'm only streaming ripped mp3's and iTunes music, but the functionality and ease of use is great. These are not cheap, but they are sturdy and barring accidents, they should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Oaks

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy Addition
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to add to my existing Songs system that is set up through my house sound system. I was looking for a way to extend my music out to the patio and this is it! I wish it were weather-proof so I could leave it out there it is portable enough for me to move it in and out when I want. I just plugged it in, opened my Sonos app and followed the directions to add a new speaker and viola!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle (832 Book Review)

customer_reviews.title: Yep we love these! We got 2 to pair in our ...
customer_reviews.text: Yep we love these! We got 2 to pair in our living room because I didn't want to compromise on sound. We have split them up occasionally (brought one outside when hubby and brother were building a deck) and they still sound really good. Love the ease of set up. That's why we bought them. Perfect if you want something affordable ($300 a speaker is pricey, yes, but not when you factor in the costs of a tradional system - speakers, receiver/amp, etc) that still sounds really excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Better than Bose
customer_reviews.text: if you are on the fence between brands, this is the one to choose! These speakers are SO freaking smart!! you control them with your phone and can play from just about any source you can access from your phone! i have one in my bedroom that i set to wake me up (yes, it has an alarm feature!!!) with news. I have another in my family room that fills the whole house with a rich sound when turned up. better than Bose!!
customer_reviews.author: KDuff

customer_reviews.title: All I can say is that it works exactly like I hoped it would
customer_reviews.text: Really purchased not knowing exactly what to expect. All I can say is that it works exactly like I hoped it would. So refreshing to have something set up and work so easily and quickly. My 7 year old is playing music from his iPad as we speak! Not to mention it sounds great as well. I Purchase quite a bit from Amazon and this is the first time I've ever felt compelled to write a review. Will be purchasing additional systems immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SONOS ROCKS
customer_reviews.text: What a soundstage! Group a playbase with a sub. Group a pair of 3s five feet on either side of the playbase. They’re the close 3s. Then group another pair of play 3s 20 feet on either side of the playbase close to the ceiling. They’re the ceiling 3s.You then have 50 feet of soundstage with no footprint. SONOS ROCKS!
customer_reviews.author: Jack McSnack

customer_reviews.title: The iOS issue is a killer
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3 sonos speakers and a Connect in the house. Would give this product 5 stars, but not being able to play music or podcasts stored on the device is a terrible experience. If you pay for a streaming service that is supported by Sonos app and only listen to those services (plus the free version of Pandora and TuneIn) the system is great. If you want to play your own music library or downloaded podcasts, the skipping issue makes it useless on an iPhone. Hopefully Sonos figures this out. Otherwise a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Rome Sheehan

customer_reviews.title: Great, versatile speaker for Sonos System.
customer_reviews.text: This was an addition to an existing Sonos system. I've had the system for several years and it is rock solid. These mid-sized speakers are perfect for even a 20' by 20' room. The bass is excellent for speakers this size. Typically I have two of these speakers paired in one room for stereo effect, but one by itself works surprisingly well too.
customer_reviews.author: The old crab

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound. I have heard them before in my ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound. I have heard them before in my sister's home, and the clarity is awesome. Had a bit of trouble getting it onto my wifi at home, but one call to Sonos and everything was cleared up quickly and with complete resolution of my issue. Bottom line: One of the best speakers I have ever heard and great customer service. These are pricey, but worth every penny. I can't wait to get a few more Sonos speakers!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: PLay 3s make great surround speakers
customer_reviews.text: These sound great as surrounds mounted on the way (with the play 3 mounts) for a sonos home theater system consisting of a playbard, 2 play 3s and a sonos sub woofer. I like the sound, but have no way to compare it to my old KEF surrond system. My wife loves the sound and our guests have commented how good it sounds. Best of all it plays all the music sources from sonos when the TV isn't on. I am truly impressed with the sonos system. So easy to setup, so easy to use and so easy to get all my music to play through it.
customer_reviews.author: RBradford

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: The Sonos Play 3 is an excellent speaker and is loud with Impressive bass for a speaker this size(Just ask my neighbor). I have two of these set up in a stereo pair. They really have to be heard to to be believed. Setup was easy. My Wi-Fi isn't the best so after purchasing the Sonos Boost these Play 3 speakers will play for days without dropping connection. I can't recommend them enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: we love it
customer_reviews.text: Adding a Sonos system to our home has been a great experience. We love how easy it is to use. The flexibility is wonderful. We bought one each of Sonos 1, 3, 5, and the Bridge. Set up was very easy. An added and unexpected benefit is the way the Sonos mesh network extends the reach of our wifi to areas in the house that were weak before. This feature works great on Android phones and tablets. Unfortunately, the Apple iOS products can not access the Sonos network. All of the speakers surprise us with the quality of the sound, given the small size of the speakers. We plan to add more soon.
customer_reviews.author: Henrik B. Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Play:3. It's a great speaker for the money ($250) and is even better paired in stereo. I have three Play:1's which are fine but for a larger room the Play:3 does a better job. This one is going on my covered porch where it will sit until winter hits again. These are very easy to set up and if you haven't tried one you owe it to yourself to give one a chance.
customer_reviews.author: D J NH

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Sonos! The sound quality is great and it works really well. Ironically, the biggest advocate is my wife who dislikes all things technology and loves this! Specifically, she found the phone app really simple to use and now uses this all the time to listen to music. The other thing that I like about the Sonos is how well it integrates with my NAS box. All of my songs are captured in iTunes and they all live on a NAS box in my basement. Sonos was smart enough to access both the music on my NAS and my playlists and so I can access my entire library without having to turn on my computer. Very nice!
customer_reviews.author: Jay L

customer_reviews.title: Great system and easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: We received our Play 3 system and bridge yesterday and had it completely installed within a matter of a few minutes. The quality is awesome! I am using this unit in my office which is approximately 600 sq ft and it does the job. I figured I would need to pair another device but after listening to the one solo unit, I do not think I'll spend the extra money. On a side note, I would highly recommend checking the Sonos website to verify your router is compatible with the device. I was surprised to see a list of relatively common routers that are not supported.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Herron

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This was one my most exciting purchases ever. The android controller works flawlessly for pandora. the setup could not have been easier (it involves pressing 1-2 buttons and thats it. The sound quality is amazing. Its not surround sound but very clear. I also like the bass and treble control on my phone. Took it to my patio and was not disappointed. All in all you cant go wrong with this thing, if you can afford these... Compared with Play 5, the sound quality is in no way inferior. I ordered 1 of both but now will order more of Play 3 for smaller rooms..
customer_reviews.author: sameer

customer_reviews.title: Play 1's) which I loved, but my wife wanted some speakers upstairs
customer_reviews.text: I just upgraded my surround system (Play Bar, Sub, Play 1's) which I loved, but my wife wanted some speakers upstairs, so I purchased two play 3's, It was very easy to remove my ones from my exsisting surround set up and replace with the 3's. I love everything about the Sonos set up, Now I am up to 9 speakers in my house and loving that I can listen to what I want when I want to, The 3's most def was the boost I wanted for my surrounds. Great company, great service, and awesome products.
customer_reviews.author: Dain

customer_reviews.title: Sonos simply makes beautiful sound where you want
customer_reviews.text: We love our Sonos system. Whenever you want a little bit of music, from any device in the house, the music is there. Set up is simple, just plug in the power, press a button on the bridge and the player, and that's it. The app on iOS and Android devices makes it easy to find the device you want and select from a broad range of music sources, from your own library through to online streaming services. Whether its a little background music at dinner, some pumping dance tracks for excercise, or a meditative background on a Sunday afternoon - Sonos makes music pervasive in your home. Make only issue is its a little expensive.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Quayle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome...after connection problems
customer_reviews.text: Received my Play:3 today. Took an hour getting it connected to the network. After connecting it directly to the router with the Ethernet cable for setup, it worked. Other than my connection issues, it’s pretty awesome. Will be testing this out on the patio soon to see how it sounds out there. So far, I’m pretty impressed. Update: I've had no issues so far. But I did find out that our router/modem isn't compatible so buyer beware. If I were to add more or pair the one I have with another for stereo sound it will need to be connected again to the router for set up.
customer_reviews.author: Need more vacations

customer_reviews.title: Will not power up!
customer_reviews.text: My Play 3 stopped working 14 months after purchase date. Power light will not turn on........... I called Sonos over a dozen times in the past 9 months and NEVER once was able to speak with a Sonos customer service / phone support person. Sonos is among the worst I've ever encountered. I would not recommend Sonos for any thing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this speaker and so happy my husband loves it ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this speaker and so happy my husband loves it too as it was a gift for him. The sound is amazing and it’s incredibly easy to set up and sync to your phone. I play pandora on it all day long! Wish they had a waterproof outdoor version!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Hear and you will believe.
customer_reviews.text: I shied away from Sonos because of the price point, but once you'd experienced and heard the system, you will believe! Its so easy to set up and use. By far the best way to full any room with music. This is my firist Play:3 and a big fan. It easily fills my kitchen with sound. Love the product, love the ecosystem.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Don't wait...BUY it!!
customer_reviews.text: I own two Play 5s and wanted a play 3 for my office. The sound, while second to the Play 5 is very very good. Most people probably wouldn't notice the difference between the two. I think SONOS makes a remarkable product and their mobile app, support and software updates are the gold standard of ease.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Expensive... but oh so good.
customer_reviews.text: Yup. They're expensive. But yes, they really do sound that great. And the app is wonderful, and with Alexa integration coming this year, they're only going to get better. If you're an audiophile, these are an awesome investment to make.
customer_reviews.author: Clerical Coach

customer_reviews.title: Great Speaker - Nice Sound
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of Sonos speakers and this one did not disappoint me. Bought it for our vacation home and I simply like the sound and the ease of use. Installation as always takes a few minutes but the video / visual instructions via iPhone are making it a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Christoph A. Lebl

customer_reviews.title: it works great! I LOVE
customer_reviews.text: It took a bit to set up because my ex-husband had convoluted settings on the router, but once we figured that out, it works great! I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE that you can listen to music from all over the world with the Sonos app. The sound is amazing and it was easy to add a second unit in another room. Love this!
customer_reviews.author: T. Jacira Paolino

customer_reviews.title: Good not great
customer_reviews.text: Its a good speaker, but I can't shake the feeling that it isn't THAT much better than a PLAY:1 (of which I have 3) and that I probably should have just sprung for the PLAY:5. Despite that it does the job admirably and is a solid addition to any Sonos setup.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Can I play iTunes from your phone with it
customer_reviews.text: Great sound but I would not have purchased if I knew then I could no longer play my iTunes from my phone to it
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Get these!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg where to begin??? We have every room in our home with these speakers!!! The house rocks and is very very easy to set up!! Using Spotify u can download and play almost any song known to man!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Hickey

customer_reviews.title: Good, but overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: The product is very good, but it could be improved by allowing the user to synchronize this with youtube, etc. Furthermore, it is a bit overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Franz L.C. Kappus

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second sonos. We originally got one for our living room and loved it so much we decided to purchase a second one to put upstairs. The set up is easy, and I love being able to control it from my iPad, iPhone, or computer. The latest upgrade allowing you to directly access your iTunes and play it from the control device just makes a good thing great. I would highly recommend this product to anyone looking for a wireless speaker. While the price may be higher than other speakers the sound quality, portability, set up and overall quality cannot be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Meinecke

customer_reviews.title: Sonos is the only way to go!!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Bose wave radio and just before the return window was up on it I heard about sonos. The Sonos sound is better than the Bose! I like the fact that Sonos is controlled by your home network - this means that anyone with the app and login for your Sonos account can take control of the music. My husband can start the music using his Iphone or Ipad and I can stop it if he leaves or if I want to listen to something different. Love!! We will definitly be purchasing more to add to our home entertainment system.
customer_reviews.author: pinenut

customer_reviews.title: Its great when it works(which is rare)
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product when it actually works. Unfortunately it working is rare. I have tried multiple phones and routers. 90% of the time when opening the Sonos app, it says my Sonos device is not connected to the network. Highly recommed looking at a different brand than Sonos.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba

customer_reviews.title: great sound for size
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 of these, great sound and easy to set up and control as advertised. I am a mid 20's dude who likes loud music. 2 of these in an average size apt will fill it with sound enough to have neighbors complain. not a ton of bass (like for a party) as you would expect, but enough to enjoy for personal listening and small dance parties. Only thing to note is that Spotify Radio playlists arent supported yet (feb '14). i emailed sonos and they said it was because of Spotify. Get your s*** together Spotify or I'll go to Pandora.
customer_reviews.author: Hogan McHugh

customer_reviews.title: Adore beyond words.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Sonos fanatic for almost 10 years. You'd be hard pressed to find a system with the sound quality, flexibility, and longevity as the Sonos. Simply beyond compare!
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is amazing and fills out entire apartment
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is amazing and fills out entire apartment. You can play dozens of radio stations and use pandora, amazon prime music, spotify, etc. via the Sonos app.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Update: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Sounds nice, easy to move around. It depends on the signal strength and my phone/iPad, sometimes signal goes out. It would be even better if it had Bluetooth and an input, for example for a DVD player. Update: I am returning this due to erratic connection problems with my home network. Bought the "boost" module but it didn't help. Sonos support was helpful initially but the problem continued and I had to reset the system daily. It's a shame because I love the concept and the sound was good.
customer_reviews.author: PhilFactor

customer_reviews.title: ALEXA WILL NOT DIRECT SPOTIFY TO PLAY ON SONOS
customer_reviews.text: While the speaker sounds amazing and streams music from my preferred music service spotify, I am giving a 2 STAR review because of the poor form in connectivity. I use Alexa to stream music and was excitied to learn that Sonos now works with Alexa...............but there is a major catch........sonos works with alexa.........spotify has works with Alexa..........but Alexa will not direct Spotify to play on Alexa???????????...........completely defeats the purpose of convenience...........not only wasted a whole evening trying to determine if i was doing something wrong.............learn to find out its not a technology issue but rather a license issue..........don't know who is to blame but corporate greed is being put in front of consumer value
customer_reviews.author: Robert U

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: This is a great speaker that I'm using on wireless in my workshop to listen to Spotify, etc. Very happy with the setup and performance, although I had to google one problem with updating. It fills the whole space easily with undistorted music.
customer_reviews.author: 📚 Bookwyrm 📚Top Contributor: Brewing

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.  Great sound.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality sound. I bought a Play 5 before this and was concerned that the Play 3 wouldn't sound as good or have as much bass. I was wrong. I have to keep the bass turned way down on the EQ. highs are nice and clear as well. Perfect speaker for a small or medium sized room. I haven't tried it in a large room, but I suspect it would do fine there as well (but you may want to consider getting a pair in this case).
customer_reviews.author: Hair Bands Rule

customer_reviews.title: SONOS crazy
customer_reviews.text: These wont blow you out of your seat but they are very musical and promote listening with all the convenience the platform provides. I have gone SONOS crazy now. I have been an audiophile for more than 30 years and can say these are very good sounding speakers as long as they are not pushed past 60% volume which is all you really could expect from their size. I got the sub after listening to these and really enjoy them.
customer_reviews.author: BM Glidewell

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound in a small package
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by how well these little wireless bookshelf speakers perform. They are spendy, but if you are into Sonos you know what you are getting. I like the combination of reasonably good sound in a small form factor. When combined with the PlayBar and Sub, you have a great surround system. The nice thing is that you don't have to run any speaker wires. This system makes it super easy to retrofit a room for surround sound without having wires running all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: K. Fancher

customer_reviews.title: No problems always great sounding and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: We now have 5 of these speakers. Two of them are used in my wife's salon. Clients comment on the causality of the sound. We started getting them 5 years ago. No problems always great sounding and easy to set up. I only wish sonos made refrigerators.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kitson

customer_reviews.title: Clear sounding 3-D audio
customer_reviews.text: An incredible room speaker in it's own right. When added to a surround system, it brings dynamic audio to any 5.1 movie. When I read the reviews on Consumer Reports, we just had to try them out. Before we were strictly Bose users, but now that we have tried Sonos, I must say that we are very pleased with them. I've contacted Sonos support for a couple of minor issues, and am very satisfied with their support and extremely satisfied with the system as a whole.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Withers

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker but questionable if it is much better than the PLAY: 1
customer_reviews.text: My husband did a lot of research on the Sonos speakers and convinced me that we needed to get a PLAY: 3, in addition to our PLAY: 1s. I'm not convinced that it's worth the extra $100. I would have been fine with just the PLAY: 1s. The rooms in the house are not that big, so I don't think the difference between the two is obvious, although it may be noticeable in a house with bigger rooms and a more open floor plan. Still, I absolutely love the Sonos! They are amazing. I recommend starting off with one and testing it out, then building off of the system, depending on what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Evie FoxTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: I love Sonos, but if you own the Play 5s ...
customer_reviews.text: I love Sonos, but if you own the Play 5s (I own seven of them) these small guys which I bought for a tiny room, disappoints in comparison. I would return it and upgrade, but accidently threw away the box. If you can fit the big size, go with it. Fortunately I only made this one mistake and all else are big ones. Def. a different sound quality from it.
customer_reviews.author: nathan andrew

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly and looks good. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Long time dyed in the wool Sonos fanboy (8 zones, beta tester etc). I bought a couple of these along with some wall mountsfor my kitchen and bathroom (note this model is not a waterproof model but the new play:1 is, but at the price so what if the steam kills one off every few years and one of these days I may swap it for a play:1). Works perfectly and looks good. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M.

customer_reviews.title: Great System
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this system with 2 speakers for 3 years and it is great. This month we have young house guest staying with us for 2 or 3 months. They have Widespread Panic playing in their bedroom and we have Christmas music playing in the family area - all out of the same computer. We are controlling it with our cell phones and nobody is even logged into the computer. It is expensive but very high quality (Apple Quality). You can carry a speaker anywhere you have wireless coverage, link it up and stat listening - inside, outside, in the attic or in you car in the back yard.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but only OK sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: I really though for the price I would be getting great speakers. These are not great. I bought two of the 3s and one 5, plus the connect to also use my home stereo speakers through my receiver. I don't see much of a difference between the 3 and 5 other than the size. The system works great, but the sound is much less than I expected for so much money. Still, I love having the option to play music in several rooms either the same or separately, so will but more for other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Here is my honest opinion

customer_reviews.title: But this does sound pretty good. Missing a little fullness
customer_reviews.text: Expected a little more based on price and hype. But this does sound pretty good. Missing a little fullness, but responsive. I'm hoping these sound better as they break in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We're a two SONOS house!
customer_reviews.text: Decided I needed music and internet radio with a big sound in my downstairs room--consisting of living room dining room, and bedroom. The SONOS 3 really delivers what I wanted. It sounds great! A bit pricey--perhaps at Christmas I'll treat myself to another-- but I can swing for a SONOS 1 in the bedroom.... now we're a two SONOS house!
customer_reviews.author: JMAlexandria

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and a lot of punch for the size
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and a lot of punch for the size. Nice sleek design. I got the white one so it would be less noticeable. It can be used vertically or horizontally. The only downside is that its not wireless. There is a cord. But its not that big of a deal. I live the SONOS interface and system. Easy to use and easy to connect to the bridge. Speaker and system does a great job overall. Enjoying my purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Odaffer

customer_reviews.title: Best Wifi Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I've got two of these in my home and bought two for my parents. I wasn't expecting my parents to enjoy it nearly as much as they did but within minutes they had figured out how to use the Sonos app and were playing music every morning by the time I woke up during my visit. The speakers sound great, the app is really nice and compatible with any device, and apparently it's geriatric friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas and in 10 minutes he had it up and running. He loves controlling it from his iPad, the sound is great, and the player is inconspicuous (which I like). One minor issue is that we thought the Bridge was only for streaming music from Pandora or something, but it turns out you need the bridge if you want to have your player detached from the router. Ordered one of those immediately. I think it's kind of pricey, but for the ease of use and setup, the small size, and the sound quality, it's really nice.
customer_reviews.author: gradstudent11

customer_reviews.title: Have the whole enchilada
customer_reviews.text: Never experienced SONOS before and we now have an entire house full. Subs. 3s, 5s, Bridges, PlayBar - you name it. Thrilled. Nice flat sound. Nothing exaggerated. I'm an audio pro and I thoroughly enjoyed the integration, customer support (had a bit of a time with 3 wireless hotspots in the house). CSR was beyond helpful, and although it took longer than expected - the system is simply FLAWLESS. Run - don't walk - to buy this stuff. It's super.
customer_reviews.author: A. Fetterman

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Great, plug and play at it most efficient. Sound is very good. Right now it is in the living room where we played Christmas music all durring the season. My wife and I have a nice sitting area in our bedroom and I'd turn it on from upstairs and enjoy easy listening seasonal music from Pandora. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Floria

customer_reviews.title: Sonos is the best music system available
customer_reviews.text: Sonos is by far the best music system for any house. This is great to connect multiple units throughout your house and have the ability to play the same song in every room. We always have people around the house, and Bluetooth speakers just don't cut it. They don't get loud and you can only have one connected in a room. These units are loud, sound great. Highly recommend Sonos.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great Speaker!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! It pumps out bass much better than my old PC speakers! And it works with the Echo.
customer_reviews.author: David Vogel

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy
customer_reviews.text: This is my entrance into whole house audio. This speaker was so easy to set up, and sounds great. It must be plugged in for power, but if you have a Sonos Bridge, you don't have to plug into the ethernet port. I've moved it around the house using it wirelessly and have had no problems. I'd like to expand my system as soon as possible, but these are priced a bit high. But even with the high price, the value is there.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ontiveros

customer_reviews.title: Audio quality so far is fantastic. I especially like that Sonos has support for ...
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly simple installation! Other companies could learn a thing or two from Sonos about how to design usable products. It took me only a couple of minutes to get the speakers up and running. Audio quality so far is fantastic. I especially like that Sonos has support for Amazon prime music (the only nitpick I have is that the app is not seamlessly integrated, so there are things you can do on the native Amazon app that you cannot do on the Sonos version of it -- like search easily.
customer_reviews.author: Zulfikar Ramzan

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Sound
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be more satisfied with the sound that comes out of that small box. It has outstanding base and excellent mid range and high range as well. The sound is very balanced with outstanding fidelity. I loaded the Sonos software on my Ipad and am having a great time exploring all the internet radio stations. I now finally have a very easy way to listen to everything in my ITunes directory. All so very simple. This is a great product and will be expanding with it to other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: TLE

customer_reviews.title: These are very nice sounding for such a small unit
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice sounding for such a small unit. Only downfall is needs to be recychornized if there's a power outage or moved from room to room. That's pretty inconvenient if the base is across mutilple rooms as in my situation.
customer_reviews.author: UltraBlue

customer_reviews.title: Just what I've been looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I love the Sonos Play:3. It does everything I was looking for. I can play music from my iTunes library stored on my desktop computer, Pandora, Spotify, and many other internet music sources. I was pleasantly surprised to find most of my local radio stations available for streaming too. The sound quality is surprisingly good for a speaker this small and is plenty loud enough for the largest rooms in our home. I did have a little trouble configuring the desktop software. I had to remove and later reinstall my security software, but once I did that, everything works great.
customer_reviews.author: gregory scott phillips

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great but do not buy it
customer_reviews.text: I failed to check the reviews before I purchased :( It sounds great on the very rare occasion it actually works. If it does work it only plays for 30secs before stopping. I get the same run around other customers do that it is the wifi in our home even though everything else works perfectly. Save your money and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: lesli terzo

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend the smaller ones (Play 1) if you are looking ...
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased 4 of these, various models, for our home. Each one has full sound and streams very well. Will be purchasing a couple more of the larger ones in the future. Would not recommend the smaller ones (Play 1) if you are looking to produce really high end volume, but they sound really good when pumped up. The new app works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Taurusman50

customer_reviews.title: brilliant sound
customer_reviews.text: So happy I bought this. I had a Player One for the bedroom and a sound bar under the TV in the family room but those 2 were about 50 feet apart so I bought this to put in the living room midway between the 2 rooms. Now I have sound throughout my entire 1800 sq foot ranch.
customer_reviews.author: Sandie H

customer_reviews.title: I love the product
customer_reviews.text: I love the product, sounds great, easy to setup, all that. What I am very disappointed in though, is that Amazon Prime Music is not supported and I did not realize that as Amazon Prime and Pandora were the main reasons I purchased this and also a Sonos 1. Amazon Music is only supported - what you have downloaded or bought - not the free prime. I really wish this was available too!
customer_reviews.author: PamS

customer_reviews.title: RIP OFF! NO LONGER SUPPORTS iTUNES!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! I only purchased because I wanted to play iTunes music...total rip off! Advertised as supporting iTunes and now it doesn’t! Scam!
customer_reviews.author: Facetime

product_meta.title: Sonos Play:3 - Mid-Sized Wireless Smart Home Speaker for Streaming Music, Amazon Certified and Works with Alexa. (Black)
product_meta.description: Style:PLAY:3| Color:BlackWirelessly stream your entire music library, favorite music services, and thousands of radio stations to any room. Place the SONOS PLAY:3 Wireless Hi-Fi System vertically or horizontally, mount it on a wall or hide on a shelf. Set up simply, and expand until every room in your home is packed with music. Control the SONOS PLAY:3 Wireless with free apps for your phone, tablet, and computer.
feature_bullets: Delivers richer and deeper sound than play:1, making it perfect for spots where you have more room
Connect your play:3 to any Amazon echo or Alexa enabled device, then just ask for the music you love
Play different songs in different rooms at the same time; Or, pump one song in perfect sync, throughout your home
Set up in five minutes using your home wifi; Easily expand your home audio system over time by adding wireless speakers to additional rooms whenever you’re ready
Wirelessly stream all your favorite music services like Amazon music, Pandora, Apple music, and Spotify

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,432 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #1,693 in Portable Bluetooth Speakers#12,945 in MP3 & MP4 Player Accessories
